unnormalised: **EV Charging Gets a Jhatka of Energy!**
normalised: **electric vehicle Charging Gets a Jhatka of Energy!**

unnormalised: Yo, car lovers! The EV scene is heating up faster than a Mumbai chai stall on a rainy day. Seems like the charging infrastructure is finally catching up.
normalised: Yo, car lovers! The electric vehicle scene is heating up faster than a Mumbai chai stall on a rainy day. Seems like the charging infrastructure is finally catching up.

unnormalised: IIT Madras just announced a new fast-charging tech that promises to juice up your Tata Nexon in, like, half the time! No more waiting longer than it takes to watch a whole Bollywood movie – remember Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge? Longer than THAT!
normalised: I I T Madras just announced a new fast-charging tech that promises to juice up your Tata Nexon in, like, half the time! No more waiting longer than it takes to watch a whole Bollywood movie – remember Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge? Longer than THAT!

unnormalised: Rumor has it, Reliance is also planning a massive rollout of charging stations across the country. Imagine charging your MG ZS EV while grabbing a samosa at a Reliance Smart Point. That's the dream, right?
normalised: Rumor has it, Reliance is also planning a massive rollout of charging stations across the country. Imagine charging your M G Z S electric vehicle while grabbing a samosa at a Reliance Smart Point. That's the dream, right?

unnormalised: Talks are swirling about government subsidies for setting up charging points in tier-2 cities too. Places like Lucknow and Jaipur might soon be EV-friendly havens.
normalised: Talks are swirling about government subsidies for setting up charging points in tier-two cities too. Places like Lucknow and Jaipur might soon be electric vehicle-friendly havens.

unnormalised: Plus, Ather Energy is supposedly working on portable chargers – no more range anxiety on that road trip to Goa! Things are changing fast, folks. Buckle up, it’s gonna be a wild ride (electrically charged, of course!).
normalised: Plus, Ather Energy is supposedly working on portable chargers – no more range anxiety on that road trip to Goa! Things are changing fast, folks. Buckle up, it’s gonna be a wild ride (electrically charged, of course!).
